name: Zaplink.releases
body:
#sidebar Menu
http://zaplink.googlecode.com/files/ZAPLink.H.gif

[http://code.google.com/p/zaplink/downloads/list?can=2&q=label%3ALastversion Ver 0.0.009] *has bugs on install* (see issue 137). This will be soon fixed by ver 0.0.009a

<wiki:toc max_depth="3" />

=Features=
  * Export ABAP components from SAP systems to files
  * Import ABAP components from files to SAP systems
  * Uninstall ABAP components from SAP Systems
  * Activate components after import
  * Handle dependencies between components
  * Provide checksums for components
  * ...
[Features Do you want to learn more ?]

=Support us=
ZAPLINK is a free software, if you like it, feel free to support us.
 

*EUR* : [https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=BXFCE2CVRCDAY https://www.paypalobjects.com/en_US/i/btn/btn_donateCC_LG_global.gif]
- OR - *USD* : [https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=SBD53GLL3PH5Q https://www.paypalobjects.com/en_US/i/btn/btn_donateCC_LG_global.gif]

= In memories =
This application is dedicated to the memories of :
  * My father : *Lamri BENSIALI* (1940-2004) without whom I never started programming
  * My uncle : *Jacky BEDU* (1934-2009) who died during the completion of this application

=Framework=
ZAPLink do not only provide features, but also a *software architecture* that allow (or try to) new features or enhancment to be made without having to change the framework. This will allow developer to have their own tools using ZAPLink features and being able to upgrade framework to the next version.

[FrameWork Do you want to learn more ?]

=Join us=
If you decide to use this framework (not for test purpose), please join the [http://groups.google.com/group/zaplink/ ZAPLink Network] and let us know what could be improved and how ZAPLink have been usefull for you.

=Tools=
Please find below tools related with ZAPLink :
  * Framework's tools : Additional tools that need the ZAPLink Framework.
  * Standalone tools : Tools based on the ZAPLink Framework but works as a standalone program without requiring to install the Framework.
==Framework's tools==
===ZAPLink version autosave===
Feature : Daily saving components to files or database to make easy rollback to any version or to retrieve component after deletion

Download : Project not finish yet, Subscribe to the [http://groups.google.com/group/zaplink/ ZAPLink Network] to request it and to be informed.
==Standalone tools==
===ZAPLink Mass Extractor===
Feature : Mass export SAP componets to files. [Tools#Mass_Extractor See documentation]

Download : [http://code.google.com/p/zaplink/downloads/list?can=2&q=label%3AStandaloneExtractor Last version]

=Download=
The last version of this framework (with only basic [Features features]) is [http://code.google.com/p/zaplink/downloads/list?can=2&q=label%3ALastversion avaliable here].
This is a *beta version*. Please report any issue [https://code.google.com/p/zaplink/issues/entry here].

You want to try ZAPLink without installing the framework ? Try the [http://code.google.com/p/zaplink/downloads/list?can=2&q=label%3AStandaloneExtractor ZAPLink Stand Alone Extractor], this stand alone program will allow you to extract SAP components into xml files. See [Tools Mass extractor] for more details on Stand alone extractor features.

[Downloads Do you want to learn more ?]

=Important notice=
Because ZAPLink is a framework and not a test program/tools it use SAP devloppements concepts like :
  * Package
  * Application logs
  * Checkpoints
Installing or using this framework will :
  # Create packages "ZAPLINK`*`" at the installation (you could choose $TMP)
  # Create application log object (ZAPLINK) and subobject which is *part of SAP customizing task* done with transaction *SLG0*. _You may *check* that you have access to this transaction in order to *be able to remove all ZAPLINK traces* if required_
  # Create checkpoint : ZAPLINK

[Warnings Do you want to learn more ?]

[http://www.sharkalliance.org/ http://wiki.zaplink.googlecode.com/hg/ssf.png?w=100&h=100] [http://www.seashepherd.org/ http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-mVaa30WRk3E/TdSkNScNXkI/AAAAAAAAGOk/mDM_D3f5eWY/s320/logo_Sea_Shepherd.jpg?w=320&h=230]
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
